answers.answer: Have they tested you to check for Type II diabetes? I was diagnosed 12 years ago with PCOS. I am also 26 years old. In 2005 my doctor ran some test and discovered the my body was producing too much insulin. He then put me on metformin 500mg 3 times a day. Since then I have also been put on Actoplus which is a medicine to treat type II diabetes and was recently switched to Glipizide. PCOS can cause increased insulin production. If not controlled it can lead to full blown diabetes in a matter of years. In 2005 I was told that I would be a full blown diabetic by now, but luckily the medicines have been able to control my insulin production therefore prolonging the inevitable. I am not trying to scare you by telling you all this, but it is very serious. PCOS will normally get better with weight loss, but if there is a problem with your insulin production you normally wont lose the weight because your body is not dissolving the sugars that you take in.PCOS can also cause high cholesterol. It literally affects every aspect of your body even though the cysts are normally on the ovaries and uterus.

question: Not so much a question as general venting and any imput is welcome!  I'm 26 and found out that I had PCOS at 19 after losing 100 pounds to join the Army (which was done all the wrong ways).  Once I got in the Army I couldn't maintain my weight.  Had doctor appointment after doctor appointment.  I knew that I starved myself to get in, but couldnt understand why I coudnt keep it off.  After 1 year and facing being kicked out of the Army, I finally made them send me off post to an endocronologist where they discovered I had PCOS.  I'm still in the Army, still overweight, and still dealing w/ the Army not happy with my fatness.I've been on metformin on and off since being diagnosed.  I HATE taking it b/c it makes me sick.  My body never got use to it.  Lowering the dosage does help, but still vomit and/or have diahrrea if my diet isn't 100%.  I basically do not take it anymore.  I'm also on birth control to help w/ having a period.  Which it had always kept me regular, but the past 6 months, that has all changed.  At first they were just starting early.. then late.. and now, it's been 3 months, and I know I'm not pregnant b/c I'm not sexually active.  I have doctor appoints lined but, but not for another month.I finally got to my largest ever at 310 in January.  that was an eye opener.  I got a personal trainer and started weight watchers.  But, weight watchers actually put weight on me b/c that was WAY more food than I ate before.  So, I quit that and start just my own calorie limitations.  So, I have lost some weight, but it has taken me 8 months to lose 40 pounds!!!  Sure, 5 pounds a month doesn't sound too bad I guess. but, I workout twice a day (all cardio, even the weight training) and eat 1000-1200 calories a day!!!  I know, that isn't "enough" but if I eat more than 1200 calories, I start to gain weight.  yes, my body hates me!  I would love to get under 200 since I'm deploying overseas next year and I really don't want to be fat in the desert for my safety and everyone elses!  The past 2 monrhs, my weight has platued eventhough I'm still doing the same things if not more.  So.... FRUSTERATED!!  I though w/ weight loss PCOS should get better!  Mine just seems to be getting worse... :(Thanks for listening!
title: annoyed w/ PCOS
